moves.5. Ng5: Committed now. This Knight has no retreat after my next move.
moves.6... Kxf7 7. Bc4+ d5 8. Bxd5+ Kg7: K-K1 may have been better. Now my King is exposed and blocking my K-side pieces.
moves.9. Bxb7: To allow his next move after I capture the B.
moves.9... Bxb7 10. Qxg4+ Kf7: I don't want to corner my K with K-R2.
moves.11. Qxf4+ Kg7: K-K3 was probably better. The King needs to avoid being cornered.
moves.12... Be7: ..and move my B in position to defend the diagonal.
moves.14. e5: A good move. The Bishop now becomes a "desperado".
moves.14... Bxh4+: A bad mistake. Now my K is fatally exposed.
moves.15. Rxh4: Now material is even, and my position is horrible.
moves.15... Ne7: Desperation. I was planning to play N-N3 in response to Q-N4 ch.
moves.16. e6+: I completely overlooked this discovered check.
moves.17... Kh7: The other move is equally bad.
moves.18. Qg7#: End of game. Well done by my opponent.
